from azure.data.tables import TableServiceClient
from unittest.mock import Mock, MagicMock, ANY
from pyspark.sql import DataFrame


class TestHelperTableStorageClientUnit(SparkSessionBaseClass):
    def setUp(self):
        super().setUp()
        self.mock_table_service_client = MagicMock(spec=AzureTableServiceClient)
        self.mock_table_client = MagicMock()
        self.mock_table_service_client.get_table_client.return_value = self.mock_table_client

        self.azure_table_client = AzureTableClient(self.mock_table_service_client, self.spark_session)


    def test_fetch_all_rowkey_values(self):
        mock_entity1 = TableEntity(PartitionKey="PAY_CODE", RowKey="BANK_CLEAR", ENTRY_FIELD="HOURS", IsProcessing=False)
        mock_entity2 = TableEntity(PartitionKey="PAY_CODE", RowKey="PAID_TIME", ENTRY_FIELD="DAYS", IsProcessing=False)
        mock_entities = [mock_entity1, mock_entity2]
        expected_result = {"BANK_CLEAR": "HOURS", "PAID_TIME": "DAYS"}

        self.mock_table_client.query_entities.return_value = mock_entities

        table_name = "yourTableName"
        table_query = "IsProcessing eq false"
        result_df = self.azure_table_client.get_all_table_entities_with_query_df(table_name, table_query)

        # Assert
        assert result_df.count() == 2
        assert isinstance(result_df, DataFrame)
